#Text=Plovdiv
#Text=Plovdiv ( Bulgarian : Пловдив ) is the second-largest city in Bulgaria , and second oldest ( if not the oldest ) city in Europe .
#Text=It is located in the large plain between the Rhodope Mountains on the south and the Balkan Range ( Stara Planina - " Old Mountain " ) that runs through the center of Bulgaria to the north .
#Text=Both ranges are visible on clear days .
#Text=The Maritsa River flows through the city on its way southeast before forming the Greek / Turkey border to the Aegean Sea .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Plovdiv is debatably the oldest continually inhabited city in Europe , with a history traced back to 6000 BC .
#Text=Originally it had seven tall hills , some of which were used for quarries .
#Text=It was originally a Thracian settlement by the name of Eumolpias .

#Text=The city has changed its name many times with new settlers and rulers : from Philippoupolis and Pulpudeva ( " the city of Philip " , the father of Alexander the Great ) , through Trimontium ( " the three hills " ) , to Pəldin , Pləpdiv ( Плъпдив ) and Plovdiv .
#Text=They also left their marks behind :
#Text=there are several Roman ruins that can be seen in or near the city center area .
#Text=During the long occupation by the Ottoman Empire , a large mosque , still present , was built in the center of the city .
#Text=During Communist times , a statue of the unnamed Russian soldier was erected on one of the three main hills which overlook the city .
#Text=Today , Plovdiv is a famous tourist destination itself and also serves as a gateway to many other points of interest .
#Text=Plovdiv is well known for hosting the Plovdiv International Fair twice a year and for its ancient , medieval and enlightenment sites .
#Text=When you are in Plovdiv , you can get help and more information about the city from one of the two tourist information centers in the city .

#Text=The first one is located in the middle of the city , right next to the post office ; when arriving in the city via train or bus through the " Yug " or " Rhodope " stations , this is one of the first buildings you 'll come across in the city center .

column1: #Text=The second one is located in the Old City , on its main street ( Saborna St ) , close to the Ethnographic museum and the beautiful church of Saint Konstantin and Elena .
#Text=Tourist information centers can help you with all kinds of information including city maps , information about concerts , bus and train schedules , and finding a place to sleep .
#Text=Plovdiv is a " European Capital of Culture " for 2019 , an honour it shares with Matera .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Plovdiv International Airport ( originally called Krumovo , PDV ) .
#Text=There are flights from/to London-Stansted and Frankfurt-Hahn via Ryanair , and Moscow-Domodedovo via S7 Airlines .
#Text=By train
#Text=The is just north of the city center , a 10-15 min walk .
#Text=There are around 15 daily trains to and from Sofia , taking 2 to 4 hours - the slower trains may require a change .
#Text=There is a sleeper train every night between Sofia , Plovdiv and Istanbul which takes about 7 hr .
#Text=In June 2019 , another train ran daytime between Plovdiv and Edirne in western Turkey .
#Text=It was meant to be a permanent service , but lasted for just one weekend then they cancelled !
#Text=It 's not known if it will ever resume -
#Text=it created a useful extra route between Bulgaria and Turkey , avoiding arrival / departure in the small hours .
#Text=By car
#Text=The A1 expressway/motorway connects Plovdiv westward to Sofia , and eastward all the way to Burgas on the Black Sea .
#Text=Other destinations require two-lane roads , such as the most direct route to Pleven , which is the somewhat adventurous Troyan pass road .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Plovdiv has 3 bus stations : , , and .
#Text=There are many buses for cities all around Bulgaria and to some that are outside the country .
#Text=Buses to destinations near Plovdiv run from Rhodope station .
#Text=Both the Yug and Rhodope stations are within five minutes walking distance from the main train station .
#Text=Yug station has an ATM located just outside so you can easily get local currency there if you 're arriving by bus from abroad .
#Text=Buses for Sofia leave from this station .
#Text=Buses run hourly from Sofia and are slightly faster than the trains ( approx. 14 leva ) .
#Text=Metro Turizm is a Turkish bus company that runs daily bus services to and from Istanbul in Turkey .
#Text=Buses going from Plovdiv to Istanbul depart from Yug Station daily at 11:00 , 14:00 , 19:00 , 22:30 , and 01:00 .
#Text=The trip costs 105 TL ( as of the summer of 2018 ) and takes roughly 7 hr , depending upon the vagaries of traffic and the border crossing .
#Text=Metro buses also depart daily for Bursa , Turkey at 19:00 .
#Text=A second bus line ( Alpar ) also has a daily bus from Yug Station to Istanbul that departs at 22:30 .
#Text=Eurolines runs a bus to Thessaloniki via Sofia that leaves at 08:00 from the Yug station , tickets can be bought on board .
#Text=Metro Turizm runs a similar service at 08:30 , tickets can be bought from the office at the station .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Taxis and buses are prevalent .
#Text=Downtown has a large pedestrian zone .
#Text=Taxis are ( Summer 2010 ) as cheap if not cheaper than bus rides when split between 3-4 people in general .
#Text=A 5-7 km of traveled distance was charged at around 5 leva ( charge for km is 0.75 leva daily and 0.95 leva nightly ) ; an average ride within the city costs around 3 leva .
#Text=The taxi arrives in about 3-5 min .
#Text=Remember to order the Taxi from the companies that offer the best deals and wait for it .
#Text=Generally taking the taxi that is already waiting will cost you more ( sometimes up to 5 times more )
#Text=avoid them or ask for a flat price that fits you !
#Text=Learn who offers best prices from the locals who often use taxis .
#Text=Most of the taxi cars have 4-digit numbers on them , remember some and use it if you need a car , for example : 6155 , 6142 , 9199 and so on .
#Text=As of summer 2011 , if your taxi ride costs more than 5 leva , you are entitled to a 20 % discount off the fare .
#Text=Public bus tickets cost 1 lev .
